Award.AwardTitle: U.S.-India Workshop and ICM Satelite Conference on p-Harmonic and Quasiconformal Mappings, Chennai, India, August 2010.
Award.AbstractNarration:
1019689
Shanmugalingam

This award supports activities associated with the International Congress of Mathematicians (ICM) 2010 taking place in Hyderabad, India, August 2010. USPI Nageswari Shanmugalingam and Indian collaborator Saminathan Ponnusamy, Indian Institute of Technology, Madras (IITM) will convene a training workshop to introduce young mathematicians to the field of p-Harmonic and Quasiconformal Mappings, as well as an ICM satellite conference to bring leading US and Indian mathematicians together for the cross-fertilization of ideas on advanced topics in Geometric Analysis. The US delegation of twelve mathematicians includes established scientists, early career, and graduate student participants.

The expectation is to foster new international collaborations and seed joint proposals for NSF and foreign counterpart agency consideration. This is one of many activities being planned around the first gathering in India of an estimated 5,000 mathematicians for the ICM and awarding of the prestigious Fields Medal. It is also a unique opportunity to promote interaction between mathematicians in the U.S. and India and address the current minimal level of collaboration with Indian mathematicians especially in Geometric Analysis.

This workshop and satellite conference is jointly funded by the Office of International Science and Engineering and the Division of Mathematical Sciences.

POR.DRECONTENT:
As part of the 2010 International Congress of Mathematicians meeting held in India, a satellite workshop titled "p-Harmonic and Quasiconformal Mappings" was held at the Indian Institute of Technology-Madras, India. The PI was one of the co-organizers of this workshop. One of the goals of this workshop was to foster cooperation between U.S. mathematicians and mathematicians working in India in the field of Quasiconformal Analysis.Ten mathematicians from the United States participated in this highly productive workshop, supported by this grant. Five of the U.S. participants contributed workshop lectures which were well-received by the international audience. Subsequent to this workshop a conference was held to provide a venue for the international participants and the US participants to inform their colleagues of their research. In total fifty mathematicians participated in the workshop and the following conference. A Conference Proceedings was subsequently published by the journal "Journal of Analysis". This proceedings was edited by the PI, together with David Minda (U.S.) and Saminathan Ponnusamy (India), and contained research articles contributed by the workshop participants and other experts in the field. Electronic files of the conference proceedings are freely available online at the website

https://sites.google.com/site/journalofanalysis/volume18

The discussion following the workshop indicated great interest on the part of the paticipants in the direction of quasiconformal analysis in non-smooth geometry. A prime example of non-smooth geometry is the geometry of Heisenberg groups. In February 2012 at the University of Cincinnati, Professor Valentino Magnani of the University of Pisa, Italy, gave an intensive short course on the geometry of Heisenberg groups. The course notes are available from him upon request.
